htmlBody: Thanks for sharing this, I will very likely try something similar in the future - perhaps I can update here if I follow through.

Hi, I think this is an interesting experiment, but I want to remind readers that this is not a sustainable strategy for learning. You should not compare your typical work day to a well-prepared cramming session.

Thanks for sharing this! This is inspiring me to do more things like this

I once did something similar where I took a week to just read and understand the AI safety fundamentals course on my own. Dedicating a whole week to it as opposed to a couple hours a week felt a lot more interesting and engaging.

There's something really powerful about setting an ambitious and short goal as opposed to something more moderate and spread out.

Thank you for sharing this! It's really useful and inspiring. One question - for the topics that you skipped, was it because you got advice that they are not useful/relevant to deep learning? 

 

Also, are you still planning to complete the programming part of your original plan? If so, how do you plan to do it?

Thanks for sharing all the resources!

What are you next steps? The python and fast.ai courses?
